intro: Desmotrichum kelsallii, commonly known as the Kelsall's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
